sections.name: laborDisclosures
sections.label: Labor rights and protection of workers

fields.name: laborChildren
fields.label: Project will not employ persons under the age of 15

fields.name: laborChildDevelopment
fields.label: Project complies with age-related legal frameworks
fields.description: Indicates compliance with the ILO Convention 138 Minimum Age Convention 1973 and/or national labor laws related to minimum age

fields.name: laborWorkersRights
fields.label: Project intends to protect and uphold the rights of workers
fields.description: The rights of workers as defined by the ILO Declaration of Fundamental Principles and Rights at Work

fields.name: laborUpload
fields.label: International standards-compliant code of conduct or other labor rights documentation

fields.name: laborComments
fields.label: Additional comments on labor rights and protection of workers

fields.name: nationalLawsCompliance
fields.label: Compliance with all applicable national laws
fields.description: Attestation of compliance with the applicable national laws of the project country

fields.name: legalComplianceTable
fields.label: Legal compliance

columns.name: legalComplianceTableVerification
columns.label: Compliance verification
columns.description: The entity responsible for verifying compliance with the given law or regulation. N/A if not applicable.

fields.name: communityFrameworks
fields.label: Measures taken to comply with frameworks governing the rights of Indigenous, tribal, and local communities
fields.description: If relevant, description of the measures taken to adhere to national or international frameworks supporting the rights of Indigenous, tribal and local communities (including the UN Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples)

fields.name: nationalLawsMethod
fields.label: Method of compliance proof

fields.name: culturalSite
fields.label: The project site includes or borders archaeological sites or districts listed in national or international registries of historical or cultural significance
fields.description: Disclosure of proximity to dedicated areas of archaeological or cultural significance which are recognized by municipalities, counties, state, national and/or international registries

fields.name: archaeologicalActivity
fields.label: Project site contains, or is contiguous with, an area designated as sensitive for archaeological activity
fields.description: Areas designated can be at the local, regional, state, national, or international level

fields.name: culturalSiteRegistry
fields.label: Registry recognizing the site
fields.description: Examples include UNESCO World Heritage registry and/or national equivalents

fields.name: culturalSiteDesignation
fields.label: Purpose of the site's designation
fields.description: Indication of the type of historical, cultural, or archeological distinction granted to the site

fields.name: parisCompliance
fields.label: The country where this project occurs is a party to the Paris Agreement

fields.name: parisNdcApplicability
fields.label: The project is counted towards the country's Nationally Determined Contributions (NDCs)
options: Yes, counted towards the country's NDC where project occurs
Yes, counted towards the funding country's NDC
No, not counted towards a national-level NDC

fields.name: parisLetter
fields.label: Evidence of project's inclusion in the Nationally Determined Contribution (NDC) and/or Paris Agreement
fields.description: Link to the letter of approval for the corresponding adjustment if needed

fields.name: carbonAuthorization
fields.label: Project is authorized for carbon use
options: Yes, I have a government concession
Yes, I have authorization from the owner (private)
Yes, I have full rights over the carbon
fields.description: Authorization of carbon use indicates that the project activity is legally allowed to be executed

fields.name: carbonRightsDetails
fields.label: Carbon rights overview
fields.description: Overview of the project's right to claim the carbon credits generated by the project activity

fields.name: carbonCreditOwnership
fields.label: Carbon credit ownership documentation
fields.description: Documentation or supporting evidence of carbon credit rights/ownership

fields.name: carbonConservationContract
fields.label: Concession contract is at least the same length as the crediting period
fields.description: Relevant for public land projects

fields.name: carbonUpload
fields.label: Land or facility ownership documentation

fields.name: carbonIssuing
fields.label: Project is receiving or seeking credit for reductions and removals under another GHG program

fields.name: carbonIssuingYes
fields.label: Evidence of no double issuance

fields.name: carbonRegistration
fields.label: Project has registered under other GHG programs

fields.name: carbonRegistrationYes
fields.label: Registration number and date of project inactivity under other GHG program

fields.name: carbonRejection
fields.label: Project has been rejected by another GHG program

fields.name: carbonRejectionYes
fields.label: Program name(s), reason(s) and date of rejection

fields.name: economicDisplacementExplain
fields.label: Expected economic displacement effects
fields.description: Possible risks or impacts to the project community that would create obstacles to the ability to find, retain, or secure economic opportunity in the project area

fields.name: economicDisplacementPlan
fields.label: Mitigation plan in place to address economic displacement effects
fields.description: Project plan to mitigate possible obstacles to economic opportunity for the project community due to project activities

fields.name: economicDisplacementDetails
fields.label: Overview of activities included in the mitigation plan
fields.description: Mitigation may include, but is not limited to, avoidance, minimization, mitigation, and/or compensation activities

fields.name: physicalDisplacementExplain
fields.label: Expected physical displacement effects
fields.description: Relocation, loss of residential land, or loss of shelter as a result of involuntary acquisition of land and/or involuntary restrictions on land use or on access

fields.name: economicDisplacementPlanEvidence
fields.label: Documentation of mitigation plan for economic displacement
fields.description: Supporting evidence of the economic displacement mitigation plan

fields.name: physicalMitigation
fields.label: Mitigation plan in place to address physical displacement effects
fields.description: Project plan to mitigate possible relocation, loss of residential land, or loss of shelter due to project activities

fields.name: physicalMitigationDetails
fields.label: Details of mitigation plan to address physical displacement
fields.description: Mitigation may include, but is not limited to, avoidance, minimization, mitigation, and/or compensation activities

fields.name: physicalDisplacementSupportingEvidence
fields.label: Documentation of mitigation plan for physical displacement
fields.description: Supporting evidence of the physical displacement mitigation plan

fields.name: communityDescription
fields.label: Communities and other stakeholders impacted or potentially impacted by the project
fields.description: The communities and other stakeholders impacted (or potentially impacted) by project activities

fields.name: stakeholderIdentificationProcess
fields.label: Stakeholder identification process
fields.description: Overview of the method utilized to identify stakeholders that may be affected by project activities

fields.name: communityImpactDetails
fields.label: Details on expected impacts to communities and stakeholders
fields.description: Overview of the potential impacts the project could incur on the various identified stakeholders

fields.name: expectedImpactsDocument
fields.label: Expected stakeholder impacts supporting documents
fields.description: Documentation, evidence, or recommendation records which substantiate expected stakeholder impacts

fields.name: stakeholderConsultationActual
fields.label: Project has developed a stakeholder consultation plan
fields.description: This plan describes how the project will engage, inform, and gather feedback from people or groups affected by or interested in its success

fields.name: consultationDetails
fields.label: Overview of stakeholder consultation plan
fields.description: This can include frequency of meetings, format types (e.g. 1-1 interview, roundtable discussions, focus groups), and how these discussions will be recorded and addressed

fields.name: communityConsultationNegativeDetails
fields.label: Justification for the absence of a stakeholder consultation plan

fields.name: consultationDocuments
fields.label: Stakeholder consultation plan supporting documents
fields.description: Documents could include a community consultation process overview, consultation timeline, registry-specific documents or questionnaires, etc.

fields.name: healthImpactCommunication
fields.label: Potential health impacts disclosure will be communicated during consultations
fields.description: In the case a project has expected health impacts to the community, these risks will be communicated to stakeholders during the consultation and engagement process

fields.name: healthImpactDisclosure
fields.label: Expected health impact disclosure
fields.description: Outcome of expected community health impacts due to project activities (e.g., changes in potable water quality, pollutant impact, hazardous wastes)

fields.name: socialGroupConsult
fields.label: Project plans to consult and engage with specific vulnerable social groups
fields.description: Indicates whether the project is expected to consult specific groups, such as women, people with disabilities, and/or other minority groups (among others) who may be disproportionately affected by the project compared to other groups

fields.name: socialGroup
fields.label: Groups expected to be the focus of outreach and consultations
fields.description: The specific groups that carry a particular emphasis in the consultation or engagement plans

fields.name: socialGroupConsultDetails
fields.label: Overview of consultation/engagement plans with identified social groups
fields.description: Engagement plans or processes with the identified specific vulnerable communities (e.g., women-only consultations or focus groups)

fields.name: socialGroupPositiveImpacts
fields.label: Expected positive impacts of the project activity on the identified social groups
fields.description: Expected benefits for the identified social groups (e.g., increased leisure time for a targeted demographic due to the project's implementation)

fields.name: socialGroupRiskDetails
fields.label: Potential risks to the identified social groups
fields.description: Description of any possible risks and/or negative impacts the project may have on the identified social groups

fields.name: socialGroupRiskPlanUpload
fields.label: Risk mitigation plan for identified social groups documentation
fields.description: Documents showcasing risk mitigation plans

fields.name: womenEmpowerment
fields.label: Project monitors gender equality/empowerment impacts

fields.name: exploitation
fields.label: Project addresses harrassment or exploitation of women within the household or other project areas
fields.description: Indication of whether the project addresses exploitation, harassment of women and/or minority groups in the community

fields.name: socialGroupGenderConsultations
fields.label: Project plans to conduct gender sensitive consultations
fields.description: Examples include data collection methods comprised of women-only respondents

fields.name: womenRights
fields.label: Women are formally and fairly entitled to project-related resources
fields.description: For example, if women are formally and fairly entitled to project-related land, water, or other types of resources

fields.name: womenRightsDescription
fields.label: Overview of gendered resource entitlement
fields.description: Description of how women are formally and fairly entitled to project related land water and or other types of resources

fields.name: genderActionPlanResources
fields.label: Resources and tools used for gender action plan development
fields.description: Identification of frameworks, resources, or other tools used to inform the project's gender action plan

fields.name: socialGroupMonitoringPlan
fields.label: Description of gender action plan and resources utilized
fields.description: Overview of the project's approach to monitoring and/or addressing gendered impacts (e.g., safeguarding against negative impacts or enabling positive impacts)

fields.name: genderActionPlan
fields.label: Gender action plan
fields.description: Action plan identifying gender inequalities and detailing how the project will address them

fields.name: communityExists
fields.label: Project activities take place in close proximity to tribal or Indigenous lands or otherwise affect Indigenous peoples
fields.description: Project activities either take place in, border, or affect resources that impact nearby recognized or known indigenous territories

fields.name: communityConsultation
fields.label: Indigenous people and/or local communities, including minority groups within, have been informed and agreed to project activities
fields.description: Following principles of Free, Prior, and Informed Consent as indicated in international humanitarian law, such as the UN Declaration on the Rights to Indigenous People

fields.name: landRightsRec
fields.label: Project contains explicit contracts with Indigenous, tribal, and local communities before the project begins
fields.description: In line with Free, Prior, and Informed Consent principles, the project and the indigenous, tribal, and/or local community have agreed on clear contractual terms governing project activities and operations

fields.name: carbonContractLength
fields.label: Length of project contract with Indigenous, tribal, and local communities
fields.description: Indication of contract length or agreed upon time before reassessment of contract terms with relevant indigenous, tribal, or local communities

fields.name: contractPublic
fields.label: Publicly available information on the contracts with communities or governments
fields.description: Openly available documentation of contracts

fields.name: contractPenalty
fields.label: Penalty clauses on the contracts for Indigenous, tribal, and local communities
fields.description: Description of any contract clauses that hold the counterparty responsible for compensation (e.g., financial payments, infrastructure repairs) in case of breach

fields.name: specialMeasureDetails
fields.label: Data integration into free, prior, and informed consent
fields.description: Details on how data was integrated into free, prior, and informed consent

fields.name: grievance
fields.label: Project will establish a grievance mechanism to enable stakeholders to report and address concerns
fields.description: Indicates whether the project will set up a formal process or channel (e.g., email, written submissions, listening sessions) for individuals, groups, or communities to raise complaints or concerns about project impacts, with structured procedures for recording grievances and responses

fields.name: grievanceReport
fields.label: Grievances and other reported issues are made public
fields.description: Indicates whether the public and project community have access to uncensored records of submitted grievances

fields.name: grievanceDate
fields.label: Date by which grievance mechanism was/will be open to communities
fields.description: Date when the grievance mechanism first became (or will become) operational (e.g., project start date)

fields.name: grievanceDetails
fields.label: Overview of the grievance mechanism available for stakeholders
fields.description: Description of the grievance mechanism, including how it works, who can access it, and the general measures for responding to grievances (e.g., monthly community listening sessions with follow-up, a monitored email inbox with a ticketing system, or other methods suited to the local context)

fields.name: grievanceSupport
fields.label: Grievance mechanism supporting documents
fields.description: Uploads may include details on the grievance mechanism's structure, reported issues addressed, and availability date

fields.name: benefitSharing
fields.label: Project will implement a benefit sharing model
fields.description: Benefit sharing with the local community (e.g. subsidization of products, revenue sharing etc.)

fields.name: benefitSharingNoExplanation
fields.label: Rationale for no benefit sharing
fields.description: If relevant, explanation of how benefits related to the carbon credit project are established and assigned to different stakeholders

fields.name: benefitSharingExplanation
fields.label: Benefit sharing model explanation
fields.description: If relevant, explanation of how benefits related to the carbon credit project are established and assigned to different stakeholders

fields.name: benefitUpload
fields.label: Benefit sharing agreement supporting documentation
fields.description: Supporting evidence of the benefit sharing agreement

fields.name: benefitSharingCommunities
fields.label: Benefit sharing agreement in place with Indigenous communities
fields.description: Indicates whether a benefit-sharing agreement exists specifically with Indigenous communities near the project area

fields.name: benefitSharingType
fields.label: Benefit sharing type offered to Indigenous, tribal, and/or local communtities
options: In-kind benefits or public goods - Local infrastructure improvements
In-kind benefits or public goods - Local employment
fields.description: Indicates the type of benefit-sharing agreement established

fields.name: iplcOwnershipPercent
fields.label: Current or projected % of company owned by Indigenous, tribal, and local communities
fields.description: Percentage of ownership held by Indigenous Peoples and Local Communities (IPLC) in the company or organization developing the project

fields.name: benefitSharingPercent
fields.label: Projected % sale price going to Indigenous, tribal, and local communities
fields.description: Percentage of the carbon credit sale price projected to go directly to Indigenous, tribal, or local communities involved in the project

fields.name: airMonitoringPlan
fields.label: Project has or will implement an air pollution monitoring plan
fields.description: Air pollution monitoring plans often include pollutants to be monitored, frequency of monitoring, and outlined data collection/mangement practices

fields.name: airMonitoringDomains
fields.label: Domains included in the air pollution monitoring plan
fields.description: Project plans may focus on indoor air quality, ambient air quality, or both

fields.name: airMonitoringDescription
fields.label: Description of air pollution monitoring plan
fields.description: Details of the air pollution monitoring plan the project intends to implement

fields.name: airMonitoringPlanEvidence
fields.label: Air pollution monitoring plan documentation
fields.description: Evidence of the project plans to monitor air pollution

fields.name: airExpectedImpacts
fields.label: Summary of expected air quality impacts of the project activity
fields.description: Description of expected air quality impacts, such as improved indoor air quality for households using the project technology

fields.name: baselineComparisonPlan
fields.label: Project plans to measure pollutants against baseline air quality
fields.description: If the project conducts a baseline air quality study (before project start or using a control site), monitoring results will be compared against these baseline levels

fields.name: airMonitoringBaseline
fields.label: Pollutants monitored in baseline air quality
fields.description: Air monitoring can include continuous measurement of criteria air pollutants or tracking of the air quality index in a target region, for example

fields.name: airBaselineDescription
fields.label: Description of baseline air quality
fields.description: Information on baseline or control air quality in the project area before project activities (indoor, ambient, or both)

fields.name: airBaselineEvidence
fields.label: Baseline air quality documentation
fields.description: Documents related to baseline air pollution, including air quality measurements or calculations. Baseline indoor air pollution data may come from field or lab tests, technology operation models, or expert opinions, while ambient pollution data may use regional datasets

fields.name: waterImpact
fields.label: Project activity takes place near a water basin
fields.description: Project is located near an area where water (from rainfall, snowmelt, or groundwater) collects and flows into a body of water such as a river, lake, or ocean

fields.name: waterMonitoringPlan
fields.label: Project plans to monitor water resources
fields.description: Water monitoring plans typically specify which pollutants and water levels or availability will be monitored, along with procedures for data collection and management

fields.name: waterMonitoringFrequency
fields.label: Monitoring frequency of water resources
fields.description: Details on how frequently the project developer will monitor water resources affected by the project activity

fields.name: waterMonitorIntention
fields.label: Description of water resources monitoring plan
fields.description: Details of the water monitoring plan the project intends to implement

fields.name: waterLocalDetails
fields.label: Summary of expected water impacts of the project activity
fields.description: Description of any expected impacts on water quality or availability

fields.name: waterBaselineCondition
fields.label: Project evaluates initial water resources
fields.description: Project conducts a baseline water survey

fields.name: waterBaselineDescription
fields.label: Description of baseline water resources
fields.description: Summary of baseline water resources (i.e., baseline water survey results)

fields.name: baselineWaterEvidence
fields.label: Baseline water resource supporting documents
fields.description: Evidence or documentation of baseline water analysis

fields.name: waterStewardship
fields.label: Water-related activity classification within the project activity
options: Land conservation and restoration - Land conservation (protection and preservation)
Land conservation and restoration - Land cover restoration
Water supply reliability - Agricultural water demand reduction measures
Water supply reliability - Operational efficiency measures
Water supply reliability - Consumer use efficiency measures
Water supply reliability - New water supply for water irrigation
Water access - Access to drinking water supply
Water Quality - Agricultural best management practices
Water Quality - Constructed wetland treatment systems
Aquatic habitat restoration - Wetland restoration and creation
Aquatic habitat restoration - Legal transactions to keep water in-stream
Aquatic habitat restoration - In-stream barrier removal
Aquatic habitat restoration - Floodplain inundation/reestablish hydrologic connection
Water Governance - direct engagement in water governance and pulic water management
Catalytic activities - Activities that pave the way for longer-term water stewardship outcomes
fields.description: Classification of water-related activities undertaken as part of the project activity (e.g., water demand reduction, water efficiency measures, land restoration, etc.)

fields.name: expectedWaterImpacts
fields.label: Expected water impacts as a result of the project activity
options: Project affects local ground water recharge rates
fields.description: Type of water-related impact anticipated from project activities

fields.name: ecosystemBiome
fields.label: Biome type
fields.description: Type of biome in which the project operates

fields.name: biomeDescription
fields.label: Description of the biome
fields.description: Biome type in the context of the IUCN Global Ecosystem Typology Version 2.0

fields.name: biomeRiskCategory
fields.label: Description of the biome risk category
fields.description: Biome risk category in the context of the IUCN Global Ecosystem Typology Version 2.0

fields.name: ecosystemCategorization
fields.label: Ecosystem categorization
fields.description: As per the IUCN, ecosystem risk refers to an ecosystem's vulnerability of collapse, determined by reductions in geographical distribution or degradation of the components of ecosystems and the services they provide (more information can be found here: https://assessments.iucnrle.org/)

fields.name: biodiversityImpactDrivers
fields.label: Summary of expected biodiversity impacts of the project activity
fields.description: Description of expected biodiversity and other ecosystem impacts of the project and their drivers. Impacts can include both positive and negative impacts, as well as both inside and outside the project area.

fields.name: biodiversityMonitoring
fields.label: Project plans to identify and monitor related biodiversity impacts before, during, and after project implementation
fields.description: Project plans ongoing biodiversity monitoring of the broader environment or at least one identified variable (e.g., at-risk species)

fields.name: biodiversityMonitoringProcess
fields.label: Biodiversity monitoring plan
fields.description: The process of identifying and monitoring relevant biodiversity indicators (e.g., fauna, flora, and non-timber forest products) before and after project intervention

fields.name: biodiversityMonitoringPlan
fields.label: Biodiversity monitoring plan documentation
fields.description: Documentation or supporting evidence of the biodiversity monitoring plan

fields.name: endangeredSpeciesConditional
fields.label: Project may pose risks to threatened or endangered species
fields.description: Identification of any expected negative impacts on threatened or endangered species

fields.name: threatenedSpecies
fields.label: International Union for Conservation (IUCN) threatened and endangered species
fields.description: Overview of the threatened and endangered species in the surrounding geographic region or otherwise potentially affected by project activities

fields.name: biodiversityLegal
fields.label: Legal framework governing the threatened and endangered species
fields.description: The regulatory frameworks governing monitoring, protection, or project impacts on threatened or endangered species

fields.name: baselineBiodiversity
fields.label: Project has conducted an initial biodiversity survey
fields.description: Biodiversity baseline survey conducted to monitor elements such as species abundance, habitat area, and related factors

fields.name: baselineSoilSurvey
fields.label: A baseline soil health survey been conducted
fields.description: Indicates whether a baseline soil quality study (before project start or using a control site) has been conducted

fields.name: baselineSoilSurveyUpload
fields.label: Baseline soil health survey
fields.description: Baseline soil health survey documentation (e.g., survey findings, template)

fields.name: soilType
fields.label: Primary type of soil order type of project site
fields.description: Each of the twelve soil orders represents a grouping of soils with distinct characteristics and ecological significance

fields.name: erosionDiligence
fields.label: Area in which the project takes place is at high risk for erosion
fields.description: High erosion risk, defined by the World Atlas of Desertification Global Erosion Map, with R factors of 20 or higher indicating ‘high erosion risk’

fields.name: soilEffects
fields.label: Summary of expected soil impacts of the project activity
fields.description: Description of expected soil impacts (e.g., physical, chemical, and biological soil ecosystem impacts). If relevant and known, the assessment should reference soil temperature, type, and chemistry)

fields.name: soilMonitoringPlan
fields.label: Plan in place for soil testing and monitoring
fields.description: Indicates if the project will follow a protocol to sample, measure, and analyze soil health and changes caused by project activities

fields.name: soilMonitoringPlanDetails
fields.label: Overview of soil monitoring plan
fields.description: Description of the soil monitoring plan, including testing types and frequency

fields.name: permanenceNumber
fields.label: Permanence
fields.description: The projected duration (in years) over which removed carbon will be stored or prevented from entering the atmosphere, accounting for risks of reversal over time

fields.name: carbonStorageDetails
fields.label: Carbon storage overview
fields.description: Details on how the carbon is stored and the estimated duration for which it remains stored in a safe and stable manner

fields.name: removalProcess
fields.label: Carbon removal process
fields.description: Carbon removal process refers to the specific mechanism by which a carbon dioxide removal (CDR) method sequesters CO₂ from the atmosphere, categorized according to the IPCC AR6 framework based on its role in the carbon cycle (e.g., biological, geochemical, ocean-based, or chemical pathways)

fields.name: removalProcessOther
fields.label: Other carbon removal process

fields.name: storageType
fields.label: Storage type
fields.description: Carbon storage type refers to the form and location in which removed carbon is stored, categorized by the IPCC as terrestrial/biological (e.g., biomass, soil), geological (e.g., rock formations), marine/oceanic, or product-based (e.g., durable materials), each with varying levels of stability and permanence

fields.name: storageTypeOther
fields.label: Other storage type

fields.name: avoidableRiskTable
fields.label: Assessment of avoidable risks
fields.description: Avoidable or intentional risks for carbon projects are risks that can be reasonably mitigated through proper project design, implementation, and management (e.g., financial viability, operational or technical risks related to project management, project design and execution, project governance, contractual breaches, disputes, etc.)

fields.name: durStakeholderAnalysisRmifw
fields.label: Durability stakeholder analysis
fields.description: All stakeholders includes all indigenous peoples and local communities with statutory or customary rights to land or resources in the project area(s) as well as description of past/ongoing disputes over land or resources in the project area(s) and their resolution or future resolution.

fields.name: opportunityCostAnalysisRmifw
fields.label: Opportunity cost analysis
fields.description: Opportunity cost analysis shall be based on the net present value (NPV) of the alternative land uses identified in the project's additionality assessment, except where most baseline activities are subsistence driven. Where most baseline activities are subsistence driven, an NPV analysis is not required.

fields.name: financialViabilityRmifw
fields.label: Financial viability
fields.description: Financial viability includes two main components: 1. The number of years until breakeven is reached (i.e.,the payback period). 2. The funding secured relative to what is needed to implement and operate the project until reaching breakeven.

fields.name: unavoidableRiskTable
fields.label: Assessment of unavoidable risks

fields.name: politicalRiskRmifw
fields.label: Political risk
fields.description: Mean should be averaged over the most recent five years of available data

fields.name: reversalRiskOther
fields.label: Project risk assessment
fields.description: Optional additional context on the assessment of potential project risks (i.e., risks to carbon durability, risks to project viability, and/or risks to credit delivery)

fields.name: riskSummaryUpload
fields.label: Risk assessment documentation
fields.description: Any documentation supporting the risk assessment

fields.name: riskManagementPlan
fields.label: Risk management plan in place
fields.description: A risk management plan encompasses a strategy for managing and mitigating risks that could impact a carbon project's ability to generate valid credits

fields.name: adaptiveCapacityEvaluationSeceltionRmifw
fields.label: Adaptive capacity evaluation selection
fields.description: Adaptive capacity can be described as considerations a project proponent has taken into account when developing a project that mitigates future risk of climate change. Please refer to the Verra AFOLU Non Permanence Risk Tool for further details on the options provided.

fields.name: reversalRiskMitigationStrategy
fields.label: Reversal risk mitigation strategy
fields.description: The strategy to address the potential loss of sequestered carbon by using financial tools or reserves, such as insurance or buffer pools, to compensate for potential reversals and ensure long-term credit validity

fields.name: durStakeholderConsultationRmifw
fields.label: Durability stakeholder consultation

fields.name: adaptiveCapacityEvaluationSupportinEvidenceRmifw
fields.label: Adaptive capacity evaluation supporting evidence

fields.name: riskPlan
fields.label: Risk management plan
fields.description: Overview of the project's plan to mitigate risk (i.e., a systematic overview of the measures taken to mitigate and/or monitor reversal and project risks)

fields.name: riskManagementPlanUpload
fields.label: Risk management plan supporting documents

fields.name: otherReversalRiskMitigationStrategy
fields.label: Other reversal risk mitigation strategy type

fields.name: insuranceOwner
fields.label: Insurance policy issuer and owner

fields.name: insuranceEvidence
fields.label: Insurance supporting evidence

fields.name: reversalEvent
fields.label: Reversal event(s) has occured
fields.description: Reversal events can include fire, pest and disease, extreme weather (e.g., drought, hurricane), geological risk (e.g., earthquakes, volcanoes), sea-level rise, and other events

fields.name: upwardAdjustmentBaseline
fields.label: Project allowment of upward adjustment to the baseline
fields.description: Some carbon crediting programs allow or require that a new baseline be established in the event of a reversal. Does the program used allow or require for a baseline adjustment to occur in the event of an unavoidable reversal?

fields.name: reversalEventType
fields.label: Type of reversal event(s)

fields.name: upwardAdjustmentBaselineDetails
fields.label: Upward adjustment to the baseline decision details
fields.description: Provide context on decision of how to adjust the baseline (if applicable) in the event that an unavoidable reversal occurs.

fields.name: reversalEventTypeOther
fields.label: Additional details on reversal event(s)

fields.name: reversalEventTypeLink
fields.label: Evidence of reversal event(s)

fields.name: reversalEventStatus
fields.label: Status of reversal event(s)

fields.name: reversalEventStatusLink
fields.label: Evidence of status of reversal event(s)

fields.name: compensation
fields.label: Risk mitigation mechanism(s) have been implemented

fields.name: compensationMechanismDescription
fields.label: Description of risk mitigation mechanism(s) in place

fields.name: compensationDetails
fields.label: Evidence of implementation of risk mitigation mechanism(s)

fields.name: socioImpactSummary
fields.label: Summary of actual socioeconomic impacts due to project activities
fields.description: A high-level overview of the socioeconomic impacts associated with the project activities

fields.name: socioParentConditional
fields.label: Socioeconomic impacts monitored by the project

fields.name: stakeholderEngagementImpact
fields.label: Project demonstrates ongoing engagement with identified stakeholder throughout the project lifetime
fields.description: Community engagement is integrated into project operations (e.g., monthly focus groups, quarterly meetings, stakeholder listening sessions)

fields.name: engagementIndigenous
fields.label: Project continually consults and engages specifically with identified vulnerable social groups
fields.description: Project maintains ongoing engagement with identified groups beyond the initial consultation

fields.name: stakeholderEngagementDetails
fields.label: Overview of the project's engagement with stakeholders
fields.description: Details include items like processes implemented for ongoing communication, format, and frequency of engagements, etc.

fields.name: engagementChannels
fields.label: Project uses tailored communication channels to communicate relevant project news to stakeholders
fields.description: Communication channels appropriate and accessible to the project area (e.g., WhatsApp, Viber, email, or text groups)

fields.name: engagementChannelsDetails
fields.label: Description of identified communication channels

fields.name: engagementFrequency
fields.label: Frequency of stakeholder engagement meetings and consultations
fields.description: Indicates the frequency of stakeholder consultation or engagement

fields.name: engagementHours
fields.label: Number of project administration hours spent in stakeholder consultations and engagement
fields.description: The total number of hours the project has spent engaging with the local community and other relevant stakeholders

fields.name: engagementPolicy
fields.label: Project engages with local policy makers, community/tribal members, or other organizational groups to inform policy recommendations
fields.description: Indicates whether the project engages in policy advocacy to promote socio-environmental benefits (e.g., supporting conservation policies, improving workforce safety, etc.)

fields.name: engagementNotes
fields.label: Stakeholder engagement session notes and outcomes are publicly available
fields.description: Indicates whether the notes and records of stakeholder meetings are accessible to the public and community members

fields.name: stakeholderEngagementUpload
fields.label: Stakeholder engagement plan supporting documents
fields.description: Supporting documentation outlining the project’s stakeholder engagement plan

fields.name: grievanceReporting
fields.label: Grievances have been reported through the established grievance mechanism
fields.description: Indicates whether any grievances, complaints, or issues have been reported through the grievance mechanism

fields.name: grievancesDescription
fields.label: Grievances and resolution pathways reported to date
fields.description: Summary of grievances submitted and actions taken to address each issue

fields.name: grievanceMechanismPublic
fields.label: Grievance reporting mechanism is publicly available
fields.description: Grievance mechanism for submitted complaints is available and accessible to the public

fields.name: genderIndicator
fields.label: Project evaluates gender impacts against specific indicators
fields.description: The project uses defined indicators to assess its gender-specific impacts

fields.name: genderIndicatorsDetails
fields.label: Overview of gendered impact and indicators against which impact is measured
fields.description: Summary of the gender-related indicators tracked by the project (e.g., percentage of women in leadership roles, increase in women’s leisure time due to project activities)

fields.name: genderIndicatorSelection
fields.label: Resources and tools used for gender performance indicator selection
fields.description: Description of the frameworks and methodologies used to select the gender indicators against which impact is measured

fields.name: genderHarassmentMeasures
fields.label: Measures taken to lessen harrassment or exploitation of women within the household and/or other project areas
fields.description: Actions the project has taken to safeguard against gender-based inequality, such as ensuring wage equity or improving women’s access to markets

fields.name: womenConsultation
fields.label: Project consults women separately on their perspectives and concerns
fields.description: Consultation may include one-on-one interviews, women-only focus groups, and/or additional field survey methods that enable separate consultation with women

fields.name: genderConsultation
fields.label: Gender-related concerns identified through consultation
fields.description: Description of how women affected by the project were consulted and how their concerns were addressed

fields.name: genderPowerPositions
fields.label: Percentage of women that hold decision making powers or leadership roles within the project
fields.description: Female-identifying individuals in managerial or senior project roles

fields.name: genderSuccess
fields.label: Women are central to the project's success
fields.description: Project success is achieved when it meets or exceeds the W+ Standards requirements for one or more of six success indicators, which span these domains: Income and Assets; Time; Education and Knowledge; Leadership; Food Security; and Health. To demonstrate success, a project must clearly define the activities that have improved women’s lives and provide meaningful, quantifiable evidence of these positive outcomes.

fields.name: genderDataCollection
fields.label: Gender impact data collection mechanisms
fields.description: Description of how data on gender-related indicators is gathered

fields.name: genderDataDetails
fields.label: Overview of approaches for collecting gender impact data
fields.description: High-level summary of how gender-related data will be collected, including methods such as private interviews or group discussions, timing, format, and how participants will be screened, sampled, and selected

fields.name: genderImpactUpload
fields.label: Gender performance impacts supporting documents
fields.description: Documents that demonstrate how gender-related data is collected, what indicators are used, and/or how the results are analyzed and reported

fields.name: indigenousContractUpdates
fields.label: Contract updates with local communities and/or Indigenous groups have occurred
fields.description: Indicates whether any agreements between parties have been updated

fields.name: indigenousContractDetails
fields.label: Description of updated contracts with Indigenous, tribal, and local communities
fields.description: Summary of additional information (e.g., penalty clauses) in the contracts with Indigenous, tribal, and local communities

fields.name: indigenousContractDate
fields.label: Date of the latest contract with community or government stakeholders
fields.description: Date of most recent contractual update

fields.name: dataInfringementIndigenous
fields.label: Data collection respects privacy rights of Indigenous peoples and local communities
fields.description: In accordance with UNDRIP principles, affirming Indigenous Peoples’ rights to access and control data about their communities, territories, cultures, and resources

fields.name: dataInfringementIndigenousDetails
fields.label: Description of privacy protection measures for Indigenous peoples and local communities
fields.description: Overview of how data privacy considerations have been integrated into project engagements and operation

fields.name: resettlementOutcome
fields.label: Project activities have resulted in involuntary displacement
fields.description: This includes both economic displacement, which encompasses the loss of land, access to assets, income sources, or means of livelihoods, and physical displacement, encompassing the result of eviction, acquisition, rehabilitation, or demolition of property, or the expiration of covenants housing. These activities can be due to involuntary acquisition / restrictions on land use or limiting access to legally designated parks and protected areas.

fields.name: householdsResettled
fields.label: Number of households involuntarily resettled due to project activities

fields.name: resettlementCauses
fields.label: Activities leading to involuntary resettlement and internally displaced persons (IDP) status
fields.description: Activities causing resettlement (e.g., protected areas restricting access, land use limitations)

fields.name: resettlementShelterProvision
fields.label: Project has made efforts to provide shelter, safety, and economic opportunities for affected persons
fields.description: Indication that resources like job placements and project housing have been offered to support resettlement assistance

fields.name: resettlementAssistanceDetails
fields.label: Overview of project resettlement assistance
fields.description: Overview of actions taken to provide necessary resettlement assistance

fields.name: resettlementProjectFunds
fields.label: Funds allocated to support the resettlement of affected community members
fields.description: Funds allocated for household resettlement due to project activities

fields.name: employmentImpact
fields.label: Project has created employment opportunities
fields.description: This can include positions within habitat/nature restoration, technical assistance, logistics, maintenance, and/or other roles which contribute to project activities

fields.name: employmentDetails
fields.label: Overview of employment opportunities
fields.description: Summary of job opportunities created through the project

fields.name: employmentFullNumber
fields.label: Number of full-time job opportunities created through project activities
fields.description: As the average for OPEC and EU work weeks, full time defined at 36 + hours per week, for at least one year. This is not a contractor employment status.

fields.name: employmentPartTimeNumber
fields.label: Number of part-time job opportunities created through project activities
fields.description: ILO defines part-time work for statistical purposes as any paid job providing less than 35 hours per week. This includes contractor positions and "on-call work".

fields.name: employmentInternshipNumber
fields.label: Number of apprenticeships or internship opportunities created through project activities
fields.description: Apprenticeships and internships defined as unpaid, or compensated by academic credit, learning opportunities to build skillsets that contribute to future employment opportunities

fields.name: employmentPolicies
fields.label: Formal policies exist within project employment opportunities to prevent and mitigate harassment
fields.description: For example, if employment not only follows local laws and regulations, but has adidtional protocols or hiring screening criteria to promote equity

fields.name: employmentPoliciesUpload
fields.label: Employment policies documentation

fields.name: employmentAge
fields.label: Average age range of project employees
fields.description: Average age ranges of people employed by the project

fields.name: employmentPositionsWomen
fields.label: Number of positions generated occupied by women
fields.description: The total number of roles created by the project that are currently held by women

fields.name: employmentPositionsIndigenous
fields.label: Number of project positions held by Indigenous or community stakeholders
fields.description: Positions held by members of identified vulnerable community groups or Indigenous peoples

fields.name: wageRateProjectDetails
fields.label: Overview of project wages

fields.name: wageRateProject
fields.label: Median wage rate for individuals employed as part of project activities

fields.name: wageRateRegion
fields.label: Median wage rate in the area in which the project is being developed
fields.description: Median wage rate in the project area (i.e., area defined as regions within 20km of project boundary)

fields.name: wageRateRegionUpload
fields.label: Median wage rate supporting documents
fields.description: Median wage rate in the project area (i.e., area defined as regions within 20km of project boundary)

fields.name: educationImpact
fields.label: Project has created additional opportunities for education or skills-building
fields.description: Opportunities such as educational webinars, on-site training on implementing project technologies or practices, and skill-sharing sessions, etc.

fields.name: educationQuantification
fields.label: Number of people with increased access to education or new skills due to project activities
fields.description: Examples include improvements in school infrastructure, classes or training sessions hosted by the project, maintenance and operation of project materials, and the development of citizen science skills

fields.name: educationTeachingHours
fields.label: Number of hours spent teaching or providing training to community members and project partners since project inception
fields.description: Examples include webinars, on-site training on implementing project technologies or practices, and skill-sharing sessions

fields.name: educationTrainingSessions
fields.label: Overview of training sessions for community members focused on knowledge and skill transfer

fields.name: educationTrainingChildren
fields.label: Engagement activities for local children to explore project resources, opportunities, and environmental benefits
fields.description: Examples include outreach to schools, organizing school visits to the project site, or collaborating on the development of environmentally-conscious curriculum

fields.name: educationSessionCadence
fields.label: Cadence of training sessions, workshops, or capacity building events

fields.name: educationScholarship
fields.label: Number of scholarships created through project activities

sections.name: economicFiscalImpacts
sections.label: Economic, fiscal, and benefit sharing impacts

fields.name: monetaryBenefitConditional
fields.label: Project engages in monetary benefit sharing
fields.description: Monetary benefit sharing refers to the distribution of financial gains from carbon credit revenues or related project income to local stakeholders who contribute to or are affected by the project

fields.name: monetaryBenefitType
fields.label: Types of monetary benefits shared
options: Fees/fee per credit sold or otherwise acquired
Licence fees in case of commercialization
Establishment and contributions to a community fund
fields.description: Monetary payment types adapted from definitions within the UN Nagoya Protocol

fields.name: revenueShare
fields.label: Monetary benefit-sharing incorporates profit or revenue distribution
fields.description: Differentiates whether communities recieve a percentage of profits or revenues of the project per benefit sharing agreements

fields.name: monetaryBenefitPrimary
fields.label: Project provides financial benefit sharing at primary sale
fields.description: When sold to a broker or organization, the project provides a financial benefit share when the project sells a credit directly from the PD to a second party

fields.name: monetaryBenefitSecondary
fields.label: Project provides financial benefit sharing at secondary sale
fields.description: In the case a credit's primary sale is to a broker, trader, or investor, this field indicates whether there is a benefit sharing during the second point of sale — when the broker, investor, or trader sells to another party

fields.name: payementsMade
fields.label: Benefit sharing financial payments made to date
fields.description: Total monetary amount distributed, including unit of currency (e.g., X USD, X yen, X pesos), as part of benefit sharing with communities

fields.name: paymentsMethod
fields.label: Payment method
fields.description: Mechanism through which the project provides monetary benefits to relevant stakeholders (e.g., direct payments, community funds, revenue sharing)

fields.name: smartContracts
fields.label: Transaction is enabled by smart contracts
fields.description: A smart contract is a digital agreement that is signed and stored on a blockchain network, which executes automatically when the contract's terms and conditions are met

fields.name: fairTradePricing
fields.label: Project engages in fairtrade pricing
fields.description: As outlined by FCC price methodology https://files.fairtrade.net/standards/FCC_price_methodology.pdf

fields.name: socialGroupBenefitSharing
fields.label: Financial benefit sharing impact on women, Indigenous, Tribal and/or other minority groups
fields.description: Details on how much money is reaching vulnerable groups, which groups/communities the payments are reaching, and how money is being used (if information is available)

fields.name: percentOwnedIndigenous
fields.label: Percent of project owned by Indigenous, tribal, and/or local communities
fields.description: Percent of project owned—with decision-making power—by Indigenous, tribal, or local communities

fields.name: paymentPercentIndigenous
fields.label: Percent of sale price going to Indigenous, tribal, and/or local communities
fields.description: How much indigenous, tribal, and/or local communities recieve from the sale of a carbon credit that has been generated

fields.name: paymentsFrequencyIndigenous
fields.label: Frequency of payments to Indigenous, tribal, and/or local communities
fields.description: Frequency of monetary payments made to Indigenous, tribal, and local communities (e.g., monthly, annually, per verification cycle)

fields.name: socialGroupBenefitSharingUpload
fields.label: Financial benefit sharing documentation

fields.name: benefitOther
fields.label: The project engages in benefit sharing aside from financial payments
fields.description: Examples of non-financial benefits can include the sharing of products or goods, technology transfer, and/or local infrastructure improvements

fields.name: benefitOtherUpload
fields.label: Non-monetary benefit sharing supporting documents
fields.description: Evidence of agreement, model, and/or distribution of non-monetary benefits

fields.name: benefitOtherDetails
fields.label: Description of non-monetary benefit sharing activities
fields.description: High-level summary of benefits shared that are not provided as an exchange of money

fields.name: benefitOtherActivity
fields.label: Non-monetary benefits implemented by the project activity
options: Sharing of research and development results
Scientific collaboration and or joint publication
fields.description: Non-monetary payment types adapted from definitions within the UN Nagoya Protocol

fields.name: localEconomyUpload
fields.label: Economic benefits supporting documents

fields.name: localEconomyImprovement
fields.label: Local economies have benefitted and improved in the project area
fields.description: Specific activity or sector-based economies have long-term benefits as a result of project activities (i.e., fisheries industry, tourism industry)

fields.name: localEconomyDetails
fields.label: Summary of economic benefits
fields.description: Summary of the economic benefits provided by the project and details on how such benefits were measured or evaluated

fields.name: povertyReduction
fields.label: Project works to reduce poverty beyond benefit sharing
fields.description: Indicates additional poverty reduction measures beyond monetary benefit sharing (expansion of safety net programs, providing microfinance loans, etc)

fields.name: povertyReductionQuantification
fields.label: Number of people impacted by poverty reduction initiatives
fields.description: Number of people that were the focus of engagement sessions, tax abatements, housing assistance, etc.

fields.name: povertyReductionTypes
fields.label: Activities undertaken for poverty reduction initiatives

fields.name: povertyReductionDetails
fields.label: Overview of the poverty reduction activities implemented
fields.description: Overview of the approach taken towards poverty reduction

fields.name: housingDetails
fields.label: Measures taken to increase safe, reliable, and/or energy efficient housing
fields.description: Summary of measures taken to provide energy efficient housing

fields.name: housingImpact
fields.label: Project engages in work to assist in the creation of safer, healthier, and more affordable homes
fields.description: This can include housing with energy efficiency (EE) upgrades such as low-flow water devices (including shower heads and bathroom or kitchen aerators); LED lighting; smart thermostats; and high-efficiency heating, ventilation, and air conditioning (HVAC) systems; as well as photovoltaic (PV) solar installations. Safety measures can include examples such as carbon monoxide monitors or smoke alarms.

fields.name: housingEnergy
fields.label: Project has created units of energy efficient housing within the area of operation
fields.description: Outside of the main project activities, project has built or contributed investment towards energy efficient homes in the project community

fields.name: housingEnergyNumber
fields.label: Number of people with increased access to energy-efficicent housing
fields.description: The number of community members benefitting from additional or retrofitted housing

fields.name: housingRetro
fields.label: Number of units retrofitted with measures to create safer, healthier, or more affordable homes
fields.description: Outside of the main project activities, the number of homes using more energy efficient measures within the project area due to project investment or programs

fields.name: tourismQuantification
fields.label: Number of visitors that have interacted with project leisure initiatives
fields.description: Number of guests or tourists who have attended or completed activities offered (e.g., facility tours, voluntourism programs, educational open farm days, etc)

fields.name: tourismDetails
fields.label: Description of measures taken to increase tourism in the region
fields.description: Summary of programs or activities offered to increase tourism opportunities for the project

fields.name: tourismActivity
fields.label: Types of leisure / tourism activities offered through the project

fields.name: tourismImpact
fields.label: Project engages in leisure or tourism activities to increase project awareness
fields.description: Includes activities such as facility tours, voluntourism opportunities, agritourism, cultural shows, cooking classes/demonstrations, etc

fields.name: healthOutcomeImpacts
fields.label: Project undertakes initiatives to enhance health outcomes or mitigate adverse impacts within the project region
fields.description: Examples of this can include providing health facilities, funding new machinery or health technology, providing health trainings as it relates to project materials (e.g. pesticide handling, stove use), or taking measures to protect or amplify native medinal knowledge.

fields.name: healthOutcomeDetails
fields.label: Description of the initiatives undertaken to increase health in the operational region
fields.description: Overview of strategies and actions implemented to mitigate community health risks

fields.name: healthRiskReduction
fields.label: Project activities reduce the following health risks

fields.name: healthOutcomePlan
fields.label: Description of health risk monitoring and remediation plans
fields.description: Overview of any measures or plans in place to mitigate risks to community health within the project boundary

fields.name: healthRiskIncrease
fields.label: Project activities may increase the following health risks

fields.name: healthOutcomeQuantified
fields.label: Quantifiable project impact on health access and outcomes
fields.description: Quantifiable metrics assessed and measured concerning health access and outcomes (i.e., the number of people reached through health training programs, the  number of health facilities updated since start of project activities, etc.)

fields.name: healthOutcomeUpload
fields.label: Health initiative impacts documentation

fields.name: sanitationUpload
fields.label: Sanitation-related activities and impacts supporting documents
fields.description: Documents supporting sanitation intiatives and/or impacts

fields.name: sanitationActivity
fields.label: Sanitation activities undertaken within project areas and/or surrounding communities
options: Waste management facilities (landfills, recycling centers, in-home composters)
fields.description: Types of activities taken to increase sanitation accessibility, outcomes, and awareness

fields.name: sanitationImpact
fields.label: Project engages in activities to increase sanitation accessibility and outcomes
fields.description: Examples include initiatives which help build waste management capacity, increase ease and access to potable water, and any type of sewage or wastewater treatment within the project area

fields.name: sanitationQuantification
fields.label: Quantifiable project impacts on sanitation processes and access
fields.description: Description of the project’s impact on sanitation-related access and outcomes (e.g., number of households gaining reliable potable water access, increased waste management facility capacity within the project area, etc.)

fields.name: sanitationDetails
fields.label: Description of sanitation activities
fields.description: Overview of programs, initiatives, and strategies implemented to improve sanitation access and outcomes

fields.name: ecoImpactsSummary
fields.label: Summary of actual ecological impacts due to project activities

fields.name: ecoParentConditional
fields.label: Ecological impacts monitored by the project

fields.name: airMonitoringStatus
fields.label: Air quality monitoring status and approach
options: Project does not currently monitor and record air pollution
Project models and estimates air quality impacts
Project monitors air pollution and has specific reduction targets
Project monitors air pollution and has met specific reduction targets during the last year of operations
Project monitors and records air pollution (no reduction targets)
Project has eliminated hazardous and toxic air pollutants from project activities entirely

fields.name: airPollutionMonitoring
fields.label: Project follows an air pollution monitoring plan which considers the following
fields.description: The air pollution monitoring plan may consider indoor air quality, ambient air quality, or human pollutant exposure

fields.name: airMonitoringPollutants
fields.label: Project pollutants monitored
fields.description: Pollutants that are monitored as part of the project activity

fields.name: airMonitoringOther
fields.label: Other pollutant(s) monitored
fields.description: Additional pollutants monitored beyond those previously specified

fields.name: airMonitoringBaselineFrequency
fields.label: Monitoring frequency of pollutants
fields.description: Details on how frequently the project will monitor relevant air pollutants

fields.name: airMonitoringMechanism
fields.label: Pollutant monitoring mechanisms
fields.description: Overview of the approach taken to monitor pollutants

fields.name: communityAirRisk
fields.label: Community members near the project site face increased risk of air pollutant exposure
fields.description: Indicates whether project activities increase exposure to harmful air pollutants

fields.name: airHealthRisks
fields.label: Assessment of health risks from air pollutant exposure linked to project activities
fields.description: Detailed assessment of health risks associated with exposure to air pollutants resulting from project activities, including any documented or observed impacts on affected populations

fields.name: exposureMonitoringMechanism
fields.label: Human exposure monitoring mechanism

fields.name: airQualityModeling
fields.label: Overview of the approach used to model and estimate air quality effects
fields.description: Overview of the methodology used to model air quality and synthesize resulting impact assessments

fields.name: indoorAirDetails
fields.label: Project activities reduce indoor air pollution
fields.description: Indicates if project activities reduce indoor air pollution compared to the baseline scenario

fields.name: indoorAirEvidence
fields.label: Indoor air pollution impacts documentation
fields.description: Documentation supporting the quantification or attribution of indoor air impacts, including field test reports, manufacturer certifications, laboratory analyses, and related evidence

fields.name: airDetails
fields.label: Project activities reduce ambient air pollution
fields.description: Indicates if project activities reduce outdoor air pollution compared to the baseline scenario

fields.name: airEvidence
fields.label: Ambient air pollution impacts documentation
fields.description: Documentation supporting the quantification or attribution of ambient air impacts, such as field test reports, manufacturer certifications, laboratory analyses, and similar evidence

fields.name: airImpactsSummary
fields.label: Summary of quantifiable project air quality impacts
fields.description: Assessment of cumulative air quality impacts attributable to project-related activities

fields.name: airVerification
fields.label: Ambient and/or indoor air impacts claimed are third-party verified
fields.description: Claimed impacts are supported by third-party verification, validation, or accreditation

fields.name: airVerificationBody
fields.label: Verification body for claimed ambient and indoor air impacts
fields.description: The third-party verifier of reported ambient and indoor air impacts

fields.name: biodiversitySpeciesHabitat
fields.label: Species habitats identified in baseline surveys have expanded due to project activities
fields.description: Overall habitat for species monitored by the project has increased due to project activities (i.e.,  conservation activities, marine protected areas, etc)

fields.name: biodiversityHabitatExtension
fields.label: Overview of species with expanded habitats and benefits from project activities
fields.description: Overview of species experiencing habitat expansion and additional ecological benefits resulting from project activities

fields.name: habitatFragmentation
fields.label: Project activities have led to species' habitat fragmentation
fields.description: Habitat fragmentation refers to the process of fragmenting large, continuous habitats into smaller, isolated patches, typically caused by human activities such as infrastructure development, construction, roads, or agriculture

fields.name: habitatFragmentationDetails
fields.label: Overview of species experiencing habitat fragmentation
fields.description: Overview of species experiencing habitat fragmentation within the project area

fields.name: biodiversitySurveyDate
fields.label: Date of most recent biodiversity survey

fields.name: biodiversityImpactsTimeline
fields.label: Reporting timeline of biodiversity impacts
fields.description: Frequency of biodiversity impact data collection, analysis, and documentation

fields.name: biodiversityEvidence
fields.label: Ecological and biodiversity impacts documentation
fields.description: Documentation related to the project's ecological or biodiversity impacts, monitoring plans or reports, permits, registry-specific assessments (e.g., the ACR Environmental and Social Impact Assessment Report template)

fields.name: speciesTrackingConditional
fields.label: Project tracks and monitors species within the project area (flora or fauna)
fields.description: Project directly tracks and monitors flora or fauna species as part of the project activity

fields.name: biodiversitySpeciesApproach
fields.label: Species tracking and monitoring approach
fields.description: How the project will collect data on threatened/endangered species

fields.name: speciesSelected
fields.label: Species selected for tracking and monitoring
fields.description: The type of species selected for monitoring, including but not limited to sentinel species, rare species, endangered species, umbrella species, keystone species, endemic species, etc.

fields.name: speciesSelectedOther
fields.label: Other species and related monitoring indicators
fields.description: Description of other species monitored, such as indicator species

fields.name: biodiversitySpeciesNumber
fields.label: Number of species (flora and fauna) within project boundaries

fields.name: threatenedSpeciesNumber
fields.label: Number of identified species which are categorized as IUCN threatened and endangered species

fields.name: speciesMonitoringFrequency
fields.label: Species monitoring frequency

fields.name: specieisSamplingDensity
fields.label: Sampling density (per hectare)
fields.description: Percentage of area sampled per hectare

fields.name: speciesCollectionMethod
fields.label: Species diversity data collection method(s)

fields.name: speciesCollectionAudit
fields.label: Species diversity data is digital and can be audited
fields.description: All biodiversity monitoring is conducted through virtual methods (e.g., citizen science apps, photo recognition tools, GPS tracking) and is auditable through digital records rather than paper documentation or verbal accounts

fields.name: specieisCollectionMethodDetails
fields.label: Overview of species identification and data collection methods
fields.description: Details on the technique and/or platform used for species identifcation (e.g., eDNA), data cataloguing, and collection

fields.name: biodiversityInvasive
fields.label: Project has engaged in efforts to control invasive species within project boundaries
fields.description: Interventions such as invasive species removal efforts designed to support the restoration and ecological balance of native ecosystems

fields.name: biodiversityInvasiveMitigation
fields.label: Implemented measures for invasive species control

fields.name: soilTesting
fields.label: Soil testing is done on a consistent basis

fields.name: soilSamplingFrequency
fields.label: Soil sampling frequency

fields.name: soilPractice
fields.label: Practices implemented to enhance soil health
fields.description: Examples include cover crops, contour buffer strips, rotational planting, rotational grazing, fallow periods, reduced tillage, no tillage, companion planting, native plant use, soil fertilizers etc.

fields.name: soilPracticeDetails
fields.label: Overview of practices used to increase soil health
fields.description: Summary of practices contributing to improved soil health

fields.name: soilQualityImpacts
fields.label: Soil quality improvements due to project activities
fields.description: Category of soil quality improvement

fields.name: soilHealthEvidence
fields.label: Soil health indicators and impacts supporting documents
fields.description: Supporting documentation for claimed soil health impacts

fields.name: waterQualityImprovement
fields.label: Project activities have improved the quality of relevant water resources

fields.name: waterQualityHouseholds
fields.label: Number of households benefiting from improved water quality due to project activities

fields.name: waterQualityPractices
fields.label: Water remediation and quality improvement practices
options: Water filtration before re-introduction to water table
Use of settling ponds to clean water before re-entry to water table
fields.description: Activities undertaken to enhance or maintain the quality of water resources, such as water filtration, desalination, grey water remediation, etc.

fields.name: waterQualityEvidence
fields.label: Water quality impacts supporting documents
fields.description: Documents supporting claimed impacts to water quality

fields.name: waterQualityMonitoring
fields.label: Project approach to hazardous and toxic wastewater monitoring
options: Project does not currently monitor and record wastewater
Project monitors and records wastewater (no reduction targets)
Project monitors wastewater and has specific reduction targets
Project monitors wastewater and has met specific reduction targets during the last year of operations
Project has eliminated hazardous and toxic wastewater from project activities entirely

fields.name: waterPollutants
fields.label: Overview of water pollutants monitored
fields.description: Summary of water pollutants monitored by project, with indication if not applicable to project

fields.name: waterQualityPracticesDetails
fields.label: Description of water treatment or quality safeguarding practices
fields.description: Overview of water treatment and testing protocols and approaches

fields.name: waterQualityLand
fields.label: Project implements water quality practices on cultivated land to protect local water sources
options: There is no application of nematicides within 20 meters of any permanent water body
There is no application of agrochemicals within 10 meters of any permanent water body
There is a riparian buffer zone at least 25 feet in width from any permanent water body
fields.description: Water quality practices on cultivated land may include the application of nematicides, riparian buffer zones, etc.

fields.name: waterQualityVolume
fields.label: Volume of water treated by project
fields.description: The amount of water treated by the project and identified unit (cubic meters, liters, etc.)

fields.name: waterAvailabilityMonitoring
fields.label: Project approach to monitoring water availability
options: Project does not currently monitor and record water volume and availability
Project monitors and records available water volume and availability (no recharge/conservation targets)
Project monitors water availability and has specific recharge/conservation targets
Project monitors water availability and has met specific water recharge/conservation targets
fields.description: Methods used to monitor and record the quantity of available water resources in the project area, including groundwater, rivers, streams, or other relevant water bodies

fields.name: waterVWBConditional
fields.label: Project uses Volumetric Water Benefit (VWB) indicators
fields.description: The Volumetric Water Benefit Accounting, published by WRI, is a common tool used to calculate and communicate volumetric water benefits of activities that contribute to meeting water stewardship outcomes, SDG targets, and help solve shared water challenges

fields.name: waterVWBIndicators
fields.label: Volumetric Water Benefit (VWB) indicators chosen
fields.description: The Volumetric Water Benefit Accounting framework can be found at https://www.wri.org/research/volumetric-water-benefit-accounting-vwba-method-implementing-and-valuing-water-stewardship

fields.name: waterMonitoringIndicator
fields.label: Other relevant indicators used for monitoring water availability impacts
fields.description: Any supplementary indicators tracked by the project beyond the core Verra Water Benefit (VWB) indicators, such as community water access, seasonal flow rates, pollution levels, or ecosystem health metrics

fields.name: waterMonitoringIndicatorDetails
fields.label: Rationale for the selected water monitoring indicators
fields.description: The reasoning behind the choice of specific water quality parameters and metrics used in the monitoring program

fields.name: waterConservation
fields.label: Project implements water conservation practices
fields.description: Indicates whether the project adopts any practices, programs, initiatives, or technical approaches aimed at conserving water within the project area or surrounding community

fields.name: waterConservationType
fields.label: Water conservation practices implemented by project
options: Irrigation water use based on monitoring and analysis of soil moisture and weather data
fields.description: Specific practices or interventions carried out to conserve water resources, such as rainwater harvesting, efficient irrigation systems, soil moisture retention techniques, water reuse initiatives, or community-based conservation programs

fields.name: waterConservationDetails
fields.label: Description of the implemented water conservation practices
fields.description: Summary of water conservation strategies adopted by the project, such as rainwater harvesting, drip irrigation, mulching, reuse systems, or behavioral change initiatives aimed at reducing water use.

fields.name: waterEnhancement
fields.label: Project enhances the volume of water in a given location
fields.description: Volume of water refers to surface water availability and/or groundwater availability which has increased due to project activities

fields.name: waterAvailabilityNumber
fields.label: Number of people who have benefitted from increased water availability as a result of project activities
fields.description: Number of individuals who have gained increased or more reliable access to water as a result of the project’s conservation efforts (e.g., beneficiaries of stream or river recharge, improved groundwater availability, or enhanced well-system performance)

fields.name: waterVerification
fields.label: Water benefits claimed are third-party verified
fields.description: Claimed impacts have been verified, validated, or accredited by a third party group

fields.name: waterVerificationBody
fields.label: Verification body for claimed water resource impacts

fields.name: waterUpload
fields.label: Water availability impacts documentation
fields.description: Evidence demonstrating water availability impacts

fields.name: marineBaselineConditional
fields.label: Project evaluates baseline aquatic or coastal ecological health in the project region
fields.description: This baseline can include ocean/river water quality and ecology, including aquatic and terrestrial flora and fauna species presence and abundance

fields.name: marineBaselineEvaluation
fields.label: Overview of baseline aquatic health evaluation
fields.description: Indication of how the project evaluates baseline aquatic health (e.g., direct measurements, model estimations, etc.)

fields.name: marineSpeciesNumber
fields.label: Number of species of vegetation within project boundaries
fields.description: The number or estimated count of plant species present within the project area

fields.name: marineEcologyDetails
fields.label: Overview of coastal or aquatic ecology within project boundaries
fields.description: Overview of the ecological composition and condition of the project area (e.g., ecosystem type - marsh, coral atolls, types of species present, etc.)

fields.name: marineEcosystemProximity
fields.label: Ecosystem(s) in close proximity to project's aquatic boundaries
fields.description: Any ecosystems not directly within but in close proximity to project geographic boundaries (seagrass meadows, mangrove forests, etc.)

fields.name: marineBaselineUpload
fields.label: Baseline coastal or aquatic health supporting documents
fields.description: Images or documents related to the region's ecological baseline  (e.g., baseline biodiversity in the region, ecological composition or condition, proximity and types of neighboring ecosystems, etc.)

fields.name: marineHealthIndicators
fields.label: Marine and coastal health indicators monitored by the project
options: Sediment/soil pollutants (pesticides, excesss fertilizer, and/or heavy metals)
fields.description: Indicators may include surface water temperature, salinity, turbidity, pH, water depth, sediment/soil type, wave exposure, etc.

fields.name: marineHealthIndicatorsDetails
fields.label: Description of indentified and/or other marine and coastal health indicators

fields.name: marineImpacts
fields.label: Summary of project impacts on coastal and marine ecosystem health as a result of project activities
fields.description: For example if species diversity was monitored, a summary of changes in flora and fauna composition and diversity through project activities compared to baseline conditions

fields.name: marineImpactsUpload
